group_1.textRight: But why did the number of people drop this much...?
Was there something that caused this?

group_1.textLeft: There was definitely some sort of bug.
I think the whole world got reset?
I heard that was the cause of people leaving.

group_1.textRight: Oh, that's what happened?
That was probably 'round the time I didn't play anymore.

group_1.textLeft: I wasn't either...

group_1.textRight: ...Is that
the "Great Void" that was mentioned in-game?
If I remember correctly, both time and everyone's memories were reset...

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, ya know? All the progress that was made
went nyooom and got tossed in the bin.
If something like that happened, you'd normally@lose motivation to keep playing...

group_1.textRight: That's why the number of players dropped...

group_1.textLeft: If there are no people in town,
then nothing happens, which is no fun.
Once again, another wave of people will quit.

group_1.textRight: But even then, the two of them are still heading to@the End of the World, without getting discouraged.

group_1.textLeft: Mhm, to the Wishing Star right above the End of@the World...

group_1.textRight: Yeah, just watching them makes me want to cheer@for them!

group_1.textLeft: You got that right, I feel like I wanna watch over our other selves
and see if they can reach the End of the World,
without us controlling them like how we did before!

group_1.textRight: I wonder if they can really make it there...

group_1.textLeft: Can'tcha just ask?

group_1.textRight: Eh, who?

group_1.textLeft: The kid who made this game.

group_1.textRight: ...A wishing star at the end of the world...?@[chara:100770:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:100770:cheek_0][chara:100770:face_mtn_ex_010.exp3.json:motion_100][chara:100770:lipSynch_1]Ahh, thaaat star.
That's actually a bug.

group_1.textLeft: Wh... Whaaat!?

group_1.textRight: Kuhuhu.@[chara:100770:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:100770:cheek_0][chara:100770:face_mtn_ex_010.exp3.json][chara:100770:lipSynch_1]Simply put, its coordinates are topological.
In other words...
it's a singularity that can't be plugged, similar to@a hole,
so light leaks through from there.

group_1.textLeft: Least "light leaks through" made sense.
So it wasn't a star...

group_1.textRight: Fixing it would've been a hassle, so I asked Nemu to write a poem for me
calling it the star at the end of the world.

group_1.textLeft: Maybe I would've been better off not asking...

group_1.textRight: It's a pretty annoying bug, or rather,@a design mistake.
It's also involved in coordinate calculations, so the@world even began to break down because of it.
There was one time where I had to rush to reset the server...

group_1.textLeft: ...Wait, so that's the truth behind the "Great Void" incident!?

group_1.textRight: So the Three Wise Sages were the culprits...

group_1.textLeft: Ah... So then, Touka-chan.
The conversation got sidetracked, but what I@wanted to ask about was this claim
that the End of the World can be found underneath@the Wishing Star...
I was wondering if that was true or not.

group_1.textRight: Hmm, it depends on your definition of the ends of@a world...
It's a non-Euclidean plane, so there are no large cliffs@or anything like that.

group_1.textLeft: Non... Euclide...?

group_1.textRight: For example, since the Earth is round,
there is no end of the world... isn't that right?

group_1.textLeft: Like how if you were to keep moving in a straight@line, you'll eventually return to the same place...?

group_1.textRight: Yup, the land in that world isn't spherical like Earth's,
but it's similar to that nyaa.

group_1.textLeft: Oh no...!
